subject: Cybersecurity
title: Bulletin Board Systems: The Hacker Underground
description: A short lesson to help you apply Bulletin Board Systems: The Hacker Underground.

hook.text: Before the web existed, hackers shared secrets on dial-up bulletin board systems.

buildup.text: BBS networks let users post files, chat, and trade exploits over phone lines in the 1980s and early 1990s.

discovery.text: Elite boards like PHRACK and 2600 became gathering places for phreakers, hackers, and security researchers.

twist.text: Law enforcement monitored these boards too, leading to the first wave of hacker arrests.

climax.text: BBS culture created the template for every online community that followed.

punchline.text: The dark web started with a phone line and a modem.

quiz.question: What did hackers use to communicate before the World Wide Web?
